## mapNth() function

Transducer. Similar to `map`<!-- -->, but only transforms every `n`<!-- -->-th input value and passes intermediate values unchanged downstream. The optional `offset` arg can be used to adjust the number of inputs before the first transformation occurs (default 0).

```
[...mapNth(3, (x) => x * 10, range(1,10))]
// [ 10, 2, 3, 40, 5, 6, 70, 8, 9 ]

// with offset
[...mapNth(3, 5, (x) => x * 10, range(1,10))]
// [ 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 60, 7, 8, 90 ]

```

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function mapNth<A, B>(n: number, fn: Fn<A, B>): Transducer<A, A | B>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  n | <code>number</code> | step size |
|  fn | <code>Fn&lt;A, B&gt;</code> | transformation function |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Transducer<A, A | B>`
